Label: 1-butyrate
Comment: short-chain fatty acids (SCFAs); other SCFAs prodcued by the intestinal bacteria are  propionic and acetic acids.</br>butyrate could reduce the absorption of dietary cholesterol by downregulating the expression of NPC1L1 in the intestines</br>Butyrate is Peroxisome Proliferator-Activated Receptor (PPAR) agonist (dor both PPARα and PPARβ)

Label: Lithocholic acid
Comment: secondary bile acid produced by intestinal bacteria</br>Could activate PXR (72), and is a vitamin D receptor (VDR) agonist.

Label: menaquinone
Comment: Figure in paper describes menaquinone, text mentiones: 'MK-4 has been found as the most common menaquinone in humans, as well as the only menaquinone converted by phylloquinone. The other menaquinone is synthesized by some obligate and facultative anaerobic bacteria. Except for MK-4, the other menaquinone in humans is mostly synthesized by intestinal bacteria. [PMID:35510250]. Therefore, annotated with overarching Vit.K2 ID from chebi (which should constitute all subforms)

Label: phylloquinone
Comment: AKA VK1</br>NPC1L1 is a regulatory factor of intestinal phylloquinone absorption

Label: menaquinone
Comment: Figure in paper describes menaquinone, text mentiones: 'MK-4 has been found as the most common menaquinone in humans, as well as the only menaquinone converted by phylloquinone. The other menaquinone is synthesized by some obligate and facultative anaerobic bacteria. Except for MK-4, the other menaquinone in humans is mostly synthesized by intestinal bacteria. [PMID:35510250]. Therefore, annotated with overarching Vit.K2 ID from chebi (which should constitute all subforms)

Label: VDR
Comment: AKA vitamin D receptor</br>VDR is a drug-activated nuclear receptor and has been shown to mediate the transcriptional upregulation of CYP2C gene.

Label: CYP2C9
Comment: AKA cytochrome P450 Family 2 Subfamily C Member 9.

Label: PXR
Comment: AKA regnane X receptor, NR1I2</br>PXR is a drug-activated nuclear receptor, and has been shown to mediate the transcriptional upregulation of CYP2C gene

Label: PPAR alpha
Comment: AKA PPARA, PPARα, the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor α</br>activation of PPARα and PPARβ will decrease the expression of NPC1L1 in intestines

Label: SR-BI
Comment: AKA Scavenger receptor class B member 1

Label: PPAR beta
Comment: AKA PPARB, PPARβ, the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor β;  PPARbeta (formerly PPARdelta)</br>activation of PPARα and PPARβ will decrease the expression of NPC1L1 in intestines
